properties.name: fields
properties.rawdescription: Defines a FieldConfig configuration for Formly.

properties.name: generateChips
properties.description: Transforms a filtering config model to an array of partial filter chip objects. Optionally, other properties from FilterChip are allowed, for example, a custom remove callback to be executed when a chip is being removed.
properties.rawdescription:
Transforms a filtering config model to an array of partial filter chip objects.
Optionally, other properties from `FilterChip` are allowed, for example, a custom `remove` callback to be executed when a chip is being removed.

jsdoctags.comment: An object with defined structure (e.g. by schema).

An array of partial filter chip objects, each containing at least displayValue and the actual value to be updated. Optionally, other properties from FilterChip are allowed, for example, a custom remove callback to be executed when a chip is being removed.

properties.name: getFilter
properties.description: Transforms a filtering config model (e.g. coming from schema form component) to a query object. However, using schema form component is not necessary. Model can be defined arbitrarily but must converted to a valid query object.
properties.rawdescription:
Transforms a filtering config model (e.g. coming from schema form component) to a query object.
However, using schema form component is not necessary.
Model can be defined arbitrarily but must converted to a valid query object.

jsdoctags.comment: An object with defined structure (e.g. by schema).
A query object to be used to generate a query string (QueryUtils).

properties.name: model
properties.description: Defines a model that will be applied to rendered form.
properties.rawdescription: Defines a model that will be applied to rendered form.

properties.name: schema
properties.description: Defines a JSON schema for filtering config model. Can be used instead of fields
properties.rawdescription: Defines a JSON schema for filtering config model. Can be used instead of `fields`
